bibl.title: The Butehamon Project. Coptic ""Traces and Paths"" in the Theban Necropolis.

Coptic Society, Literature and Religion from Late Antiquity to Modern Times. Proceedings of the Tenth International Congress of Coptic Studies, Rome, September 17th-22nd, 2012 and Plenary Reports of the Ninth International Congress of Coptic Studies, Cairo, September 15th-19th, 2008. I; - II

bibl.note: The data collected in different areas of the necropolis (graffiti, tombs and pathways) can add some light to the Coptic re-use of these sites.
bibl.seg: Giacomo Cavillier, The Butehamon Project. Coptic ""Traces and Paths"" in the Theban Necropolis.

Paola Buzi, Alberto Camplani & Federico Contardi (edd.), Coptic Society, Literature and Religion from Late Antiquity to Modern Times. Proceedings of the Tenth International Congress of Coptic Studies, Rome, September 17th-22nd, 2012 and Plenary Reports of the Ninth International Congress of Coptic Studies, Cairo, September 15th-19th, 2008. II = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 247 (Leuven - Paris - Bristol, CT, 2016) pp. 1495-1500, 3 figg.
The data collected in different areas of the necropolis (graffiti, tombs and pathways) can add some light to the Coptic re-use of these sites.
